title: Luminar receives a larger $33 million bid for its lidar business
summary: A new leading bidder has appeared in the Luminar bankruptcy case: Redmond, Washington-based MicroVision, which beat out Quantum Computing Inc.'s bid by $5 million.

title: China’s Moonshot releases a new open-source model Kimi K2.5 and a coding agent
summary: The company said that the model was trained on 15 trillion mixed visual and text tokens.

title: Node-based design tool Flora raises $42M from Redpoint Ventures
summary: Flora's node-based design tool is being used by companies like Pentagram and Lionsgate.

title: Uber launches an ‘AV Labs’ division to gather driving data for robotaxi partners
summary: Uber is not developing its own robotaxis again; instead it plans to collect and offer data. It's a bet that more volume will help autonomous vehicle partners solve the weirdest edge cases.

title: Northwood Space secures a $100M Series B and a $50M Space Force contract
summary: This is the El Segundo, California-based startup's second raise in less than a year.

title: ‘Among the worst we’ve seen’: report slams xAI’s Grok over child safety failures
summary: “We assess a lot of AI chatbots at Common Sense Media, and they all have risks, but Grok is among the worst we’ve seen,” Robbie Torney of Common Sense Media said.

title: South Korea’s Edenlux set for U.S. debut of eye-strain wellness device
summary: Edenlux builds wearable tech to protect and train your eyes, inspired by its founder’s personal vision recovery.

title: Qualcomm backs SpotDraft to scale on-device contract AI with valuation doubling toward $400M
summary: SpotDraft now processes over 1 million contracts annually using its AI tool, with contract volumes up 173% year-over-year.

title: Google pays $68M to settle claims its voice assistant spied on users
summary: Google did not admit wrongdoing in the settlement of the class-action case, which accused the firm of "unlawful and intentional interception and recording of individuals’ confidential communications without their consent and subsequent unauthorized disclosure of those communications to third parties."

title: AI chip startup Ricursive hits $4B valuation two months after launch
summary: Ricursive joins Recursive and Unconventional AI in raising massive funds at multi-billion valuations out of the gate.

title: Meta to test premium subscriptions on Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp
summary: In the coming months, Meta is going to explore a premium experience on Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp that gives users access to special features and more control over how they share and connect, while keeping the core experiences free.

title: Some international attendees are skipping 2026 GDC due to safety fears and growing ICE presence
summary: Many members of the international games industry are skipping the 2026 Game Developers Conference because of the growing ICE presence and other concerns.

title: Vinod Khosla publicly disavows Keith Rabois’ comments on ICE shooting
summary: Unwavering Trump loyalist and VC Keith Rabois caused his colleague  and his firm's founder to distance themselves from his comments on ICE.

title: YouTubers sue Snap for alleged copyright infringement in training its AI models
summary: The YouTubers claim Snap, like others, used AI datasets meant for research and academic use to train its AI models.

title: Here’s the tech powering ICE’s deportation crackdown
summary: From phone spyware and facial recognition to phone unlocking technology and databases and more, this tech powers Trump's deportation machine.

title: Social network UpScrolled sees surge in downloads following TikTok’s US takeover
summary: UpScrolled is a social network that pledges to remain impartial to political agendas. It blends familiar features from Instagram and X, letting users share photos, videos, and text posts, discover new content, and send direct messages.

title: Rad Power Bikes reaches deal to sell itself for $13.2M
summary: A company called Life Electric Vehicle Holdings has emerged as the top bidder for Rad Power's assets. It's not clear what the company plans to do with them, though.

title: AI startup CVector raises $5M for its industrial ‘nervous system’
summary: Now, founders Richard Zhang and Tyler Ruggles are tasked with a bigger challenge: showing customers and investors how this AI-powered software layer translates to real savings on an industrial scale.

title: TikTok alternative Skylight soars to 380K+ users after TikTok US deal finalized
summary: Skylight, co-founded by CEO Tori White and CTO Reed Harmeyer, offers a built-in video editor; user profiles; support for likes, commenting, and sharing; and the ability for community curators to create custom feeds for others to follow.

title: Anthropic launches interactive Claude apps, including Slack and other workplace tools
summary: Claude users will now be able to call up interactive apps inside the chatbot interface, with Cowork integration coming soon.

title: Pinterest cuts workforce by around 15 percent to focus on AI
summary: Pinterest is planning to lay off hundreds of workers and reduce its office space to reallocate resources for its artificial intelligence initiatives. In a regulatory filing posted Tuesday, Pinterest says the reduction is expected to impact "less than 15 percent" of its current workforce, and that the layoffs should be complete by September 30th, 2026. The Trifold first premiered in Korea late last year, so […]

title: Google Photos now lets you describe how to transform images into video
summary: Google is giving Photos users more control over the app's generative AI photo-to-video feature. Google Photos now supports text prompts for video generation, according to the update announcement on Monday, allowing users to describe the specific movement, style, or effect they want to see when bringing still images to life. title: Roland’s TR-1000 is the ultimate drum machine

title: Xbox Cloud Gaming’s new design teases the future of Xbox console UI

title: Strava and Komoot finally bring offline maps to Apple Watch
